modules.description: Provides functions to manage UDP connections, including listening on ports, handling incoming packets, writing datagrams with optional source and TTL settings, and disconnecting. Operates on types such as IP addresses, Cstruct.t for packet data, and custom error types. Used to route network traffic, process incoming UDP messages, and send packets with controlled source and destination parameters.

The module offers functionalities for managing network connections and data transfer, including establishing, terminating, and controlling data flow over TCP. It interacts with network flows, IP addresses, and ports, supporting operations like buffered writes and error handling. Use cases include reliable communication in distributed systems and real-time data exchange.

Provides pretty-printers for errors, IP addresses, and prefixes. Handles IP layer operations such as demultiplexing incoming packets, sending data with configurable fragmentation and TTL, and generating pseudoheaders for checksums. Works with IP addresses, prefixes, and network interfaces, supporting IPv4-specific operations like retrieving configured IP ranges and MTU values.

Returns the current POSIX time in days and picoseconds, retrieves the local time zone offset in seconds, and provides the clock's picosecond period. Operates with integer and 64-bit integer tuples to represent time values. Used for precise time calculations, timezone-aware timestamp generation, and clock synchronization.

Handles request routing, response generation, and connection management for Gemini protocol servers. Processes text and binary data streams, and manages HTTP-like status codes and headers. Used to create real-time, secure, and efficient Gemini sites with custom middleware and endpoint logic.
